intro: Lobelia drungjiangensis, commonly known as the Drungjiang lobelia, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its tubular, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to violet. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth. Its leaves are lanceolate and covered with fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branching. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
